msItem.author: Remius Favinus
msItem.title: Carmen de ponderibus et mensuris
msItem.incipit: Pondera peonis ueterum memorata libellis
msItem.explicit: nec non et sine aquis

msItem.note: Text on the measures
msItem.incipit: Mensura centum sextarii
msItem.explicit: libra grece lx librę atticę talentum.

msItem.author: Fulbert of Chartres
msItem.title: De libra et partibus eius
msItem.incipit: Libralis as ex unciolis constat duodenis
msItem.explicit: mediam secuntiam iungens.

msItem.author: Fulbert of Chartres
msItem.title: De uncia et partibus eius
msItem.incipit: Uncia uiginti scripulos et quattuor ambit
msItem.explicit: scripulis seu gramma retentant.

msItem.author: Fulbert of Chartres
msItem.title: De scripulo et partibus eius
msItem.incipit: Unus item scripuli calcis componitur octo
msItem.explicit: calcus ciceris duo granula pensans.

msItem.title: Liber Alchandrei, § 17
msItem.incipit: Sciendum est quam uis sol moritur in uno quoque signo
msItem.explicit: et secunda hora connumerantur scorpioni et sic deinceps.

msItem.note: Mnemonic verses for the months of the year
msItem.incipit: Procedunt februe quinta sub sorte KL
msItem.explicit: None iuni explentur tribus

msItem.note: Table of content presenting the ten books.
msItem.rubric: In hoc corpore continentur libri clementis numero decem
msItem.incipit: Primus liber ex his quae misit ad eum continent de uero propheta
msItem.explicit: de his ergo singulis quae aput.

msItem.note: Praefatio ad Gaudentium episcopum:
msItem.rubric: In hoc codice habentur sancti clementis libri numero X
msItem.incipit: Tibi quidem papa Gaudenti nostrorum decus
msItem.explicit: quam apostolo exhiberet.

msItem.note: Text of the ten books:
msItem.incipit: Ego clemens in urbo roma natus ex prima aetate
msItem.explicit: ei gratiam quam apostolo exhiberet.
msItem.note: Division: f.19r Lib. II; f.33r Lib. III; f.49v Lib. IV; Lib. V; f.62r Lib. VI; f.65r Lib. VII; f.70v Lib. VIII; f.82v Lib. IX; f.88rLib. X
msItem.decoNote: Large decorated initial P on f.4r; ca. 6-line decorated initials on ff.19r, 33r, 70v, 82v, 88r; left space for initial on f.62r, f.65r.

msItem.author: Ps-Clemens
msItem.note: Spurious Decretal Epistle of Clemens to Jacob translated by Rufinus
msItem.rubric: Incipit epistola Clementis ad Iacobum fratrem domini
msItem.incipit: Clemens jacobo domino episcopo episcoporum recenti hebreorum
msItem.explicit: quae pręcipit exponere iam incipiam.
msItem.bibl: Die Pseudoklementinen. Vol. 2: Rekognitionen in Rufins Übersetzung. Edited by Bernhard Rehm. Berlin: Akad.-Verl., 1994, pp. 375-387.

msItem.note: Another letter:
msItem.rubric: Item alia eiusdem clementis epistola ad eundem Iacobum
msItem.incipit: Clemens Jacobo carissimo. Quam sicut a petro accepimus
msItem.explicit: qui autem non te audierit immo deum loquentem per te ipse sibi dimnationem accipiet.

msItem.note: Two mathematical mnemonic verses (written by the same hand but in a fainter ink):

msItem.incipit: Adsistunt domino seniors bis duodem
msItem.explicit: Tercia namque tribus super pars unica solus.

msItem.incipit: Quattuor et pentas duo monas tres mias unus
msItem.explicit: Tum quoque cuncto.
msItem.bibl: MGH Poetae lat. aevi carol. 4, p. 1119

msItem.title: Series annorum mundi nova
msItem.note: World chronicle of the six ages (from Adam to Charlemagne)
msItem.incipit: Adam cum esset annorum CXXX genuit seth
msItem.explicit: ab origine mundi usque in praesentem annum I¯I¯I¯I¯ DCCLXI.
msItem.decoNote: The text in positioned within single and double arcade; in the tympanua the artist Ingelard drawn portraits of the Patriarchs or biblical scenes (including Abraham as astronomer with astrolab), together with some zoomorphical decoration or drolleries. For description see Yvonne Deslandres, “Les manuscrits décorés au XIe siècle à Saint-Germain-des-Prés par Ingelard,” Scriptorium 9 (1955): 3–16.

msItem.note: Continuation with a list of Roman emperors and kings:
msItem.incipit: Ante ęneam isti reges fuerunt in italia Ianus Saturnus Picus
msItem.explicit: Carlomannus atque Carolus item et Carlomannus et hludouicus.

msItem.bibl: MGH SS, Auct. ant., Vol. XIII, pp. 349-354.

msItem.note: Chronica based on Isidore's Etymologiae, Lib. V, 39.
msItem.rubric: Item alia chronica. Prima aetas seculi
msItem.incipit: Primo die condidit deus lucem. Secundo firmamentum caeli
msItem.explicit: Hludouicus reganuit annis XXVII. Et inde domnus Karolus et deo protegente gubernauit annis XXX et uno.

msItem.note: List of Frankish kings from Merovech to Henry I.
msItem.incipit: Ex genere priami fuit Merouens qui genuit Childericum
msItem.explicit: heynricus rex frater eius pro eo.

msItem.note: Cycli decemnovenales with the annals of Saint-Germain-des-Pres (till year 1063)

msItem.author: Fulbert of Chartres
msItem.title: De signis et mensibus et diebus et horis compendium computi
msItem.incipit:
Annum sol duodena means per signa rotundat
singula denis percurrit signa diebus
msItem.explicit: tres bissexte quadris quinis nes iungito derus.

msItem.note: Cycli decemnovenales for the years 1064 – 1196 (later addition)
Computistical argumenta
msItem.explicit: Sed quintus decimus bis denaque bina habet annus XXII.

msItem.note: blank.

msItem.title: Excerptum de astrologia
msItem.note: The text is preceded by a short note also found in Strasbourg, BNU, Ms 326 Discite de iuvenes cum Abraham caeli et cursus syderum cognoscere non cum epicureo uoluptatum adsertore ventre desevire et luxuriare.
msItem.incipit: Duo sunt extremi vertices mundi quos appellant polos
msItem.explicit: quia ad ipsum usque decurrit accipiens.

msItem.title: In quo signo versetur mars
msItem.incipit: In quo duodecim signorum mars habeatur. In quo signo uersetur mars. Annis ab initio mundi per senarium diuisis
msItem.explicit: in uirginem memoratam simper inueniri planetam.

msItem.note: Horologium viatorum
msItem.incipit: Spera caeli quater senis horis dum reuoluitur omnes stele fixe celo
msItem.explicit: qui erectus ad superna ducitur radius ad ima mersus hiemalis dicitur.

msItem.title: De ordine ac positione stellarum in signis
msItem.incipit: Est quidem hic ordo et positio syderum
msItem.explicit: Anticanis habet stellas III.
msItem.decoNote: Illustrations of the constellations with stars marked with different symbols presumably reflecting the size and magnitude of stars.

msItem.title: De spaera caeli
msItem.incipit: Haec pictura docet quicquid recitauit yginus
msItem.explicit: centaurique pedes postremos tangit et aram.

msItem.note: Excerpt from Libri computi, Lib. III, 9
msItem.incipit: Primo igitur anno praeparationis bissexti prima hora noctis
msItem.explicit: XV kalendas martias arietem posit ingredi.

msItem.note: Anonymous text on calculating the current year
msItem.incipit: Hrabanus Secundum computationem eusebii et iheronimi sunt anni ab adam usque ad diluuium II CC XLII
msItem.explicit: ad passionem dominus uenit fiunt anni V CC XXXI.

msItem.author: Helpericus
msItem.title: Liber de computo (here Abbo of Fleury’s redaction)
msItem.rubric: Incipit excerptio vel expositio compoti herici
msItem.incipit: Cum quibusdam fratribus nostris adolescentulis
msItem.explicit: Bis quaterni sunt octo remanet nihil. Sic de reliquis facies.

msItem.note: Anonymous mnemonic text on the alphabet
msItem.incipit: Omnes litere ad similitudinem uocis caracteres accepterunt A sub hiatu oris congruo solo spiritu nominamus
msItem.explicit: Z uero idcirco appius Claudius detestatur que dentes mortui dum exprimitur imitator.

msItem.author: Wandalbert of Prüm
msItem.title: Horologium
msItem.rubric: Versus domini bede ad componendum orologum
msItem.incipit: Quos cursus solis iugant sua tempora menses
msItem.explicit: Hinc centro torrens ternos sibi sexta retentat.

msItem.author: Abbo of Fleury
msItem.title: Computus vulgaris
msItem.incipit: Computus vulgaris qui dicitur ephemerida de luna

msItem.note: Collection of computistical tables, argumenta and verses.
Computistical tables.
Verse accompaning the table on f.172r
msItem.incipit: Quid subiecta ferat cognosces pagina lector
msItem.explicit: Paschalem dehinc indicat esse diem.

msItem.title: De sideribus
msItem.author: Ps. Priscianus
msItem.incipit: Ad boreae partes arcty uertuntur et anguis
msItem.explicit: Celsior his saturnus tardior omnibus astris.

msItem.note: 19-line verse on the dates of the paschal full moon.
msItem.incipit: None aprilis norunt quinos. V
msItem.explicit: quindenę constant tribus adeptis. III

msItem.note: Computistical argumenta and regula.
msItem.incipit: Anni domini notantur in psenti linea cum
msItem.explicit: Aug XIIII. Quatrenis regularibus at letatur augustus.

msItem.author: Isidore of Seville
msItem.note: Excerpt from Etymologies (V, 28-39)
msItem.incipit: Cronica grece dicitur quae latine temporum series appelatur
msItem.explicit: sexto animantia ex terra et hominem quem appelauit adam.

msItem.note: blank.
Excerpts from Libri computi, Lib. V-VI:

msItem.title: De positione et cursu septem planetarum
msItem.rubric: De positione et cursu septem planetarum
msItem.incipit: Inter caelum et terram certis discreta spatiis semptem sydera pendent
msItem.explicit: Dein morata in coitu solis biduo cum tardissimę a tricesimali luce ad easdem uices exit.

msItem.title: De intervallis earum
msItem.incipit: Interualla earum a terra multi indagare temptarunt
msItem.explicit: Ita septem tonis effici quam diapason armoniam uocant.

msItem.title: De absidibus earum
msItem.incipit: Tres autem quas supra solem diximus sitas
msItem.explicit: sicut in rotis radios ut subiecta figura demonstrat.

msItem.title: De cursu earum per zodiacum circulum
msItem.rubric: De cursu earum per cotidianum circulum
msItem.incipit: Cur autem magnitudines suas et colores mutent
msItem.explicit: et supeream duabus Saturni duabus ut sol.

msItem.incipit: Tres superiores ab exortu matutino latitudinem signiferi scandere
msItem.explicit: sydera martis maxime in obseruabilis est cursus.

msItem.title: Libri computi, Lib. V, 11
msItem.incipit: A terra ad lunam tonum esse pronuntiant
msItem.explicit: id est miliaria CVIIII et CCCLXXV.

msItem.title: De presagiis tempestatum
msItem.incipit: Et enim predictis difficilioribus transire conuenit ad reliqua tempestatum presagia
msItem.explicit: si in alteram earum aquiloniam caligo abstulerit auster saeuit. Si in austrinam aquilo.

msItem.title: Libri computi, Lib. VI, 2
msItem.incipit: Omne aurum purum cuius libet ponderis omni argento similiter puro
msItem.explicit: sicut prima lectionis huius fronte prefixum est.

msItem.title: Libri computi, Lib. VI, 3
msItem.rubric: De mensura cere et metalli in operibus fusilis
msItem.incipit: In fundendis operibus cuius ponderis metallum quodlibet ad certum
msItem.explicit: auri librae XVIIII et duodecies VIII denarii quod sunt untiae III et denarii XVI.

msItem.title: Libri computi, Lib. VI, 4
msItem.rubric: Ambrosii Macrobii Theodosii. De mensura et magnitudine terrae et circuli per quem solis iter est.
msItem.incipit: In omni orbe uel spera medietas centrum uocatur
msItem.explicit: et insuper centum septuaginta milia.

msItem.title: Libri computi, Lib. VI, 5
msItem.incipit: His dictis quibus mensura quam terrę uel ambitus uel diametros habet
msItem.explicit: Ergo ex his dicendum est sollem octies terra esse maiorem.

msItem.title: Libri computi, Lib. VI, 6
msItem.rubric: De mensura lunae vel eius magnitudine
msItem.incipit: Luna item circuli sui sexcentesimam obtinet portionem
msItem.explicit: Ipsum uero circulum centies maiorem esse tellure.

msItem.title: Libri computi, Lib. VI, 7
msItem.incipit: Eratostenes phylosophus idemque geometra subtilissimus magnitudinem terreni orbis nosse uolens
msItem.explicit: nullam humanae coniecturae dimensionem admittit.

msItem.author: Abbo of Fleury
msItem.title: Sententia Abbonis de ratione sperae (imperfect)
msItem.incipit: A studiosis astrologie primo sciendum est per geometricam
msItem.explicit: sed ex oblique natet ac nauiget.

extent.measure: iii (modern paper) + 185 fols. (foliated 1-91, 91*, 92-184) + i (unfoliated medieval parchment attached on a stub to the last quire) + iii (modern paper)

supportDesc.foliation: Modern foliation in the upper right corner.

layoutDesc.layout: Fol. 1, partly 2v, 3r-v written in two columns, 38-39 lines.
The list of kings on ff.105r-106v laid out within two arcades.
Fol. 108v written in three columns (within an arcade decoration).

scriptDesc.scriptNote: Carolingian minuscule by many hands. In general the script exhibits trends of the transitional script of the long twelfth century: upright shaft of a, e-caudata, round r after o, f and long s placed mostly on the baseline, feets on minims often curved to the right, dotting of y. In the same time there are still st, ct, rt, nt, & ligatures and the lower lobe of g is still open.

decoDesc.decoNote: Decorated initials; equatorial sundial (2v); diagrams (130v, 161v, 166r); picture cycle (105r-108v, 131r-137v).

physDesc.additions: On f.185r medical recipes (s.XI?): aduentoris dolorem aut duriciam uel inflationes id est erba quinquefolii succi coclearia ii dabis sine mora dolorem tollit. Item Plantagine Si tumor fuerit cum uino calido mixto potui da. On f. 1r and 184v note by the same hand (s.XIII) on the extent of the manuscript: In hoc libro sunt folia et nouem. primum folium on f.184 respectively ultimum folium.

history.origin: Judging by the presence of the Anneles Sancti Germani (ff.111r-126v) the manuscript was produced in Saint-Germain-des-Prés. The last king mentioned in the chronicle list on f.110v (written by a hand copying also other parts in the manuscript) is Henry I. (1031-1060), which gives a terminus post quem 1031. The terminus ante quem is provided by the annals ending 1063. Consequently the date of origin is between the years 1031-1063. Note however, that modern scholars take the last year of Henry's reign and suggest the manuscript is datable to 1060-1063. The introduction of gothic characteristic in the script suggests indeed a date in s.XI2. The illustrations and decoration are the work of the artist Ingelard (see the article of Deslandres and Vieillard-Troiekouroff).
history.provenance: The manuscript remained in the abbey till s.XV. See the former shelf-mark on f. 1r 434, 547 as well as two ex-libris notes on f.184v (s.XV?): Liber germano de pratis pertinet almo and Iste liber est Sancti Germani de Pratis Parisiensis Qui , (s.XIV?) now crossed-over and illegible on the microfilm.

On f.184r note (s.XIV?): legite librum plenum fidei confirmatione morum instructione, bonorum omnium exemplo, karitatis amore errore confusione ac omnibus doctrinis ad uitam eternam consequendam, quam nobis prestare dignet, qui est benedictus in secula seculorum amen amen benedictus sit jhesus amen.

Leonardi, p. 441. Typologie Des Sources Du Moyen âge Occidental 3. Turnhout: Brepols, 1975. Vieillard-Troiekouroff, May. “Art carolingien et art roman parisien.
